title: Head Of Business Strategy
description:
Location: Torrance, CA 

 Workstyle: Onsite 

What Makes a Honda, Is Who Makes a Honda

Honda has a clear vision for the future, and it’s a joyful one. We are looking for individuals with the skills, courage, persistence, and dreams that will help us reach our future-focused goals.

At our core is innovation. Honda is constantly innovating and developing solutions to drive our business with record success. We strive to be a company which serves as a source of “power” that supports people around the world who are trying to do things based on their own initiative and that helps people expand their own potential. To this end, Honda strives to realize “the joy and freedom of mobility” by developing new technologies and an innovative approach to achieve a “zero environmental footprint.”

We are looking for qualified individuals with diverse backgrounds, experiences, continuous improvement values, and a strong work ethic to join our team.

If your goals and values align with Honda’s, we want you to join our team to Bring the Future!

About This Position

We are seeking a highly motivated and results-driven Business Strategy Leader to join the FastPort business venture team. The role of this individual is vital in Leading and driving the execution of the project’s production and market strategy. Key responsibilities include the creation of a B2B customer/partner outreach plan, daily analyses to validate the business needs of stakeholders, and overall guidance for the team to help it make informed business decisions. Additionally, this individual will be responsible for establishing and achieving key metrics related to, identifying new business opportunities, establishing and maintaining relationships, and driving revenue growth. The Manager will be tasked with building the strategy team and function to support the growth of the overall business.

Responsibilities Include

 Lead the creation and execution of the detailed business strategies, forecasts and models to inform production and operational planning.  Accountable for the development and execution of key business performance KPIs and metrics  Lead the development and execution of solutions based on market research and analysis to identify future partnerships, new opportunities, market trends and user needs.  Responsible for leading the development of a comprehensive B2B customer/partner outreach strategy plan to generate interest in our micro-mobility products and services.  Establish and maintain strong relationships with key stakeholders, clients, and partners to drive long-term revenue growth.  Collaborate with the Business Operations and Growth teams (and other cross-functional teams) to align business development efforts with overall growth strategies.  Lead contract negotiations. 

Who We Are Seeking

 Required Work Experience: 

 10+ years of developing and executing complex business strategies.  6+ years managing business functions and direct reports  Experience in creating strategies to support growth, monetization and scale up targets.  Demonstrated success in the creation of compelling business cases.  Experience in B2B and enterprise sales required.  Experience in micromobility, shared mobility, or related industries preferred.  Experience in new business development and go to market strategies 

Required Education

 Bachelor’s degree in business, finance or other relevant degree.  MBA, preferred 

Desired Skills

 Strong knowledge of the automotive industry, products and technology  Comprehensive knowledge of all disciplines associated with Auto Research, Development, Sales, and Manufacturing  Demonstrated excellent critical thinking, business judgement, negotiating, analytical and presentation skills  Strong initiative to align the strategy with wide range of stakeholders  Strong understanding of resource management  Ability to quickly adapt to changes in business strategy to help business partners communicate solution value to key stakeholders.  Start-up environment experience is beneficial.  Proven track record of successfully generating leads, closing deals, and achieving revenue targets.  Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills.  Willingness to travel as needed for networking events, conferences, and trade shows, and business activities, etc. 

Additional Position Factors

 Workstyle: Onsite  Travel: 25% 

At Honda, you will play a key role in our journey to become a company that society wants to exist now, and in the future. Your endless curiosity will drive innovation and your courageous spirit will challenge the status quo. We believe having a workforce made up of diverse thinkers and innovators makes us a better Honda. Respect for each other and respect for diversity each and every day drives our associates to contribute at the highest level and work effectively in a team environment. We make the dream of mobility a reality with our innovative and high-quality products. Together, we Bring the Future to our customers, associates, and communities. We are Honda!

 What differentiates Honda and makes us an employer of choice? 

Total Rewards

 Competitive Base Salary: Pay will be based on several variables that include, but not limited to, geographic location, work experience, education, etc.  Annual Bonus  Industry leading Benefit Plans (Medical, Dental, Vision, Rx)  Paid time off, including vacation, paid holidays, sick time, personal days  401K Plan with company match + additional contribution  Lifestyle Bonus  Relocation assistance 

Career Growth

 Advancement opportunities  Career mobility  Education reimbursement for continued learning  Training and Development programs 

Additional Offerings

 Wellbeing program  Community service and engagement programs  Product programs  Free drinks onsite

title: Manufacturing Manager
description:
Description

Leidos Dynetics is seeking a talented Manufacturing Manager to join a diverse team to create unique solutions for complex problems. With offices across the United States engaging in the defense, space, cyber and commercial fields, Dynetics provides responsive, cost-effective engineering, scientific and IT solutions.

Primary Responsibilities

The successful candidate will support the manufacturing management team responsible for producing prototype and low-volume production hardware for the aerospace and defense industries, engineering design and production of EO/IR and RF systems, and electronic and mechanical systems, subsystems, and cable assemblies. Candidate will be expected to interface directly with multi-functional teams on technical issues and must be capable of implementing manufacturing solutions. Candidate will work closely with the engineering team to help produce complex systems.

The candidate must have experience in project activities related to mechanical manufacturing. The candidate will have demonstrated ability to follow prescribed procedures and to manage time to meet deadlines with minimal oversight.

Responsibilities Include, But Are Not Limited To

Leading the welding, fabrication, assembly, and integration teams.Compiling project status reports.Coordinating project schedules.Engaging in project meetings.Coordinating and leading proposal efforts.Identifying and resolving project issues as they arise.Coordinating project activities and ensuring all project phases are documented appropriately.

Basic Qualifications

Candidates must possess a BA/BS degree and have 5 years of relevant experience.Candidate must have 2 years leading teams and/or projects.Candidate must have demonstrated experience writing routine reports and correspondence.Candidate must have demonstrated experience reading and interpreting drawings/documents such as operating instructions, and procedures.Candidate must have demonstrated experience using Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook). Candidate must have demonstrated experience effectively communicating within a team environment.The position requires candidates to be capable of performing in a collaborative engineering environment working closely with multi-disciplinary teams.Candidate must be a resident of the North Alabama area or willing to relocate to the Huntsville - North Alabama, AL area.Candidate must be a US Citizen and possess (and be able to maintain) a Final Secret Clearance OR meet the eligibility to obtain (and maintain) a Secret Clearance.

Preferred Qualifications

Preference shown to candidates who possess a Bachelor's degree in an Business management or 5 years experience leading multi-functional teams in a manufacturing environment.Preferred candidates will also have experience and/or working knowledge with: Costpoint, Agile PLM, and Epicor ERP.Basic knowledge of Microsoft Project.

2024-04-17

While subject to change based on business needs, Leidos reasonably anticipates that this job requisition will remain open for at least 3 days with an anticipated close date of no earlier than 3 days after the original posting date as listed above.

Pay Range

Pay Range $87,100.00 - $157,450.00

The Leidos pay range for this job level is a general guideline only and not a guarantee of compensation or salary. Additional factors considered in extending an offer include (but are not limited to) responsibilities of the job, education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities, as well as internal equity, alignment with market data, applicable bargaining agreement (if any), or other law.

description:

Job Description:

Job Posting Title: Embedded Software Application Engineer

Description:

 Develop and optimize algorithms for ADAS functionalities such as adaptive cruise control, lane departure warning, automatic emergency braking, pedestrian detection, and traffic sign recognition.  Design and implement software components for real-time ADAS applications, ensuring robust performance and adherence to safety standards.  Collaborate with hardware engineers to integrate ADAS software with sensor systems (radar, lidar, cameras) and vehicle controllers.  Conduct simulation and testing of ADAS features using software tools and hardware-in-the-loop (HIL) setups to validate performance under various conditions.  Analyze and interpret data collected from field tests and simulations to improve algorithm performance and reliability.  Stay updated with industry trends and advancements in ADAS technology to incorporate the latest innovations into our systems.  Document designs, specifications, and test results to maintain clear records and support regulatory compliance.  Develop and document electronics and/or electrical solutions including HW & SW. Develop functional & non-functional requirements in the area of ADAS & Passive safety.  Strong understanding of sensor technologies (radar, lidar, cameras) and their application in ADAS systems. Familiarity with automotive communication protocols (CAN, LIN, Ethernet) and software development processes (AUTOSAR, ISO 26262).  Experience with model-based design tools for algorithm development and simulation.  Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to work effectively in a team environment.  Strong communication skills to convey complex technical concepts and collaborate with multidisciplinary teams.  Interact with the internal development teams overseas & external supplier. Secure cross-functional and business anchoring.

title: Senior Accounting Manager
description:
About Niche

Niche is the leader in school search. Our mission is to make researching and enrolling in schools easy, transparent, and free. With in-depth profiles on every school and college in America, 140 million reviews and ratings, and powerful search tools, we help millions of people find the right school for them. We also help thousands of schools recruit more best-fit students, by highlighting what makes them great and making it easier to visit and apply.

Niche is all about finding where you belong, and that mission inspires how we operate every day. We want Niche to be a place where people truly enjoy working and can thrive professionally.

About The Role

We are looking for a Sr. Accounting Manager to join our growing finance team and play an integral role in refining the financial operations of our growing business. This position will report to the controller, and will work closely with the rest of the Accounting, Finance and RevOps teams.

The right candidate for this role will be highly motivated by a fast-paced, high-growth environment, combined with a collaborative culture. This role will lead the daily accounting processes and financial reporting and will drive efficiencies, a strong control environment to enable best practices, standardization, and scale within a growing organization.

What You Will Do: 

Manage the day-to-day operations of the accounting department, including accounts payable, general ledger, and financial reportingAssisting in managing the preparation of financial reporting information and analysis for internal and external stakeholdersPartner with other departments to understand and support business processes, ensure proper accounting, and resolve reconciling differencesWork closely with FP&A to deliver budget vs actual reports to different departmentsOversee external accountants for audit and tax, and ensure timely completion of third party servicesEvaluate and Implement process and system improvements where necessary, with the goal being to close the books as quickly and accurately as possibleReview and approve sales commissionsAssist in the evaluation of any system implementation evaluations 

During the First Month:

Learn about Niche by meeting with various team members to learn more about our company through our Onboarding meetingsCollaborate with Finance, Sales, and Partnership team members to learn about the company, customers, and product offeringsUnderstand the processes for order to cash and procure to pay cyclesLearn the accounting systems including Sage Intacct, Avalara, and Salesforce

Within 3 Months:

Help complete the monthly financial close process from start to finish and produce accurate financial statementsTake ownership of revenue reporting commissions review and sales tax processesPartner with FP&A to ensure accurate financial reporting

Within 6 Months:

Work with our external accounting firm to complete the annual financial statement audit and annual tax returns, and provide required informationDefine key metrics to help analyze company performance and build reports to update automaticallyReview accounting procedures and modify or implement new procedures in order to support the introduction of new business lines and business investment plans

Within 12 Months:

Review all accounting procedures and modify or implement new procedures in order to support the business Assess the systems and technology used in accounting and reporting to determine if it meets the needs of a rapidly expanding company

What We Are Looking For

Bachelor's degree in finance or accounting, required7+ years of work related experience in accountingManagement experience required CPA highly preferred, but not requiredPublic accounting experience requiredStrong knowledge of GAAPPrevious experience with subscription-based business or products requiredPrevious experience in PE or VC is a plusProficient in SalesForceAvalara experience a plusHighly proficient in an ERP system (Netsuite, Intacct, etc)Experience with ERP implementation a strong plusStrong analytical skills and high level of proficiency with MS Excel and Google SheetsHighly organized, with good time management and prioritization skills, acute attention to detail, works with a sense of urgency to meet deadlinesSelf-starter with proven ability to research information, problem-solve and coordinate projects and initiativesAdaptable, versatile, and able to work in a fast paced and adapting environmentExcited to work in a culture of measurability and continuous optimization

Are you excited about the position and its responsibilities, but hesitant because your experience doesn't align 100% with the posted requirements? We believe you are more than a resume, so go for it! You won’t want to miss the opportunity to play a part in helping students find where they belong.

Compensation

Our national target base salary range is $121,280-$151,600, plus participation in our Annual Bonus and Stock Option Program. Base compensation will be commensurate with experience and skills.

At Niche, our Total Rewards Philosophy is centered around creating a workplace environment that attracts, motivates, and retains top talent by providing a comprehensive and competitive rewards package. This philosophy is built on the principles of performance-based compensation, best-in-class benefits and work-life balance, and employee well-being.

Why Niche?

We are a fully flexible workforce empowering our employees to choose to work remotely, in our Pittsburgh office or whatever combination suits youFull time, salaried position with competitive compensation in a fast-growing companyBest-in-class 100% paid employee health plan, including vision and dental and supplemental coverageFlexible Paid Time Off PolicyStipend that allows you to build your work from home office in a style and function that suits your personal preferencesParental leave for all employees (12 weeks fully paid) in addition to short term disability for birthing parentsMeaningful 401(k) with employer matchYour ideas and work will make an immediate impact on our company and millions of usersYou will join a team that cares about you, our mission, our work - and celebrates our wins together!

Niche will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States without sponsorship now or in the future for this opening.

We are currently hiring in states where we currently have employees: AZ, CA, CT, FL, GA, IL, IN, KY, LA, ME, MD, MA, MI, MO, NE, NH, NJ, NY, NC, OH, OK, OR, PA, SC, TN, TX, VA, WA, DC, WV.

Candidates only. No recruiters or agencies, please. Sorry, we do not offer relocation assistance.

Niche is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment with the best employees. Therefore, we provide employment opportunities without regard to age, race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable law.

All interviews are being held remotely. If there are preparations we can make to help ensure you have a comfortable and positive interview experience, please let us know.

description:
Job Description

As an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, or veteran status.

Equal Opportunity Employer: Minority/Female/Disability/Veteran

What is the value of a WM job? 

The value of a WM job is more than a paycheck. It’s a way to create opportunities for you and your family.

We Are Stable:  Our WM team is home every day, and our team members perform essential and meaningful work.

We Are Committed to Growth:  100% tuition paid for benefits eligible employees and their family, and established career progression.

We Are Investing in You: Amazing Medical, Dental & Vision, 401K with match, discounted stock options, dependent day care, and more!

Who are we? #WeAreWM

Ready to roll with us? Click Apply to join the Waste Management team today.

Join our Waste Management team, the industry leader since 1971. With over 41,000 proud employees, Waste Management has the largest trucking fleet in the waste industry - over 18,000 trucks, and leads in CNG advancement with the largest fleet of class 8 Natural Gas Vehicles in North America. We offer opportunities in 48 states, the District of Columbia, and Canada.

When you drive for Waste Management, you join a team of the best drivers in the nation - professional, well trained, and skilled. Our drivers work hard and drive safe. They know they are valued front-line team members who are the key in making Waste Management number one in the industry. They are rewarded with competitive pay, great benefits, opportunity for growth, and they are home at night and on the weekends.

I. Job Summary

Safely operates a heavy-duty truck to perform assigned duties on swing routes.

II. Essential Duties And Responsibilities

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Other minor duties may be assigned.

Operates vehicle in accordance with Occupational and Safety Health Act (OSHA) and Department of Transportation (DOT) requirements as well as all local, state and federal requirements and Company expectations for the Fleet; maintains a clean and safe vehicle. Performs pre- and post-trip inspections of assigned vehicle using utilizing standard DVIR (Driver Vehicle Inspection Report); notes all issues on DVIR form for corrective review/repair. Immediately reports any unsafe situations or service calls to Route Manager or Dispatch before attempting service. Participates and cooperates in all scheduled training, briefings, and meetings as required by Route Manager. Works closely with Route Managers to improve route efficiencies and identify problem or unsafe accounts. Performs all duties as scheduled by Route Manager or Dispatch, assisting other company drivers as directed. Notifies Route Manager of any incidents, accidents, injures, or property damage. Notifies Dispatch or Route Manager of issues as prescribed by Service Machine protocol, including blocked containers, potential missed pick-ups or problems that arise on the route. Communicates customer requests or issues to Dispatch or Route Manager. Completely dumps all containers and leaves the customer’s location clean and free of debris. Completes and submits customer tickets when excess yardage must be removed. Positions containers on the customer’s property in a manner that ensures lids are properly replaced, containers are set in an upright position, and containers do not block driveway entrances or traffic. Follows route assignments throughout the day and completes all documentation when checking-in at the end of the route. 



III. Supervisory Responsibilities

This job has no supervisory duties.

IV. Qualifications

The requirements listed below are representative of the qualifications necessary to perform the job.

 Education and ExperienceEducation: No education required. Experience: Two (2) years previous experience in a driver position.  Certificates, Licenses, Registrations or Other RequirementsCommercial Drivers License B (CDL). Eligible to legally work in the United States. Must be atleast 18 years of age.  Other Knowledge, Skills or Abilities RequiredAcceptable driving record required.  Work Environment Listed below are key points regarding environmental demands and work environment of the job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of the job. 



Normal setting for this job is: outdoors and/or driving a vehicle.

The expected hourly rate for this position is $29.76. The specific hourly rate offered to a candidate may be influenced by a variety of factors including the candidate’s relevant experience, education, training, certifications, qualifications, and work location.

Benefits

At Waste Management, each eligible employee receives a competitive total compensation package including Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance and Short Term Disability. As well as a Stock Purchase Plan, Company match on 401K, and more! Our employees also receive Paid Vacation, Holidays, and Personal Days. Please note that benefits may vary by site.

If this sounds like the opportunity that you have been looking for, please click "Apply.”

title: Communications, Services, & Projects Facilitator
description:
University of Colorado Anschutz Medical Campus

Department: School of Medicine, Office of the Dean, Offices for the Faculty Experience 

Job Title: Communications, Services, & Projects Facilitator 

Position #: 00821634 – Requisition #:33321

Job Summary:

The Communications, Services & Projects Facilitator is a new position and serves as a vital contributor to the Offices for the Faculty Experience (OFE). This position supports a cross-office team in the development, management, delivery, and communication of current and new initiatives in the School of Medicine (SOM). The Communications, Services & Projects Facilitator is exceptionally skilled in “quick learning,” has a consistently accurate understanding of these newly learned areas, and then uses their advanced skills in coordinating and communicating about these areas in which they are not an expert. The Communications, Services & Projects Facilitator is inclusive and attentive to details, “a can-do go-getter,” and service and outcome-focused. The Communications, Services & Projects Facilitator is skilled at working across both communications and diverse operational functions, independently, and in collaboration with diverse stakeholders to fulfill OFE goals and objectives.

OFE resides in the Dean’s Office in the School of Medicine on the University of Colorado Anschutz Medical Campus. The OFE team is growing and includes the Office for Faculty Affairs, the Office for Faculty Development, the Office for Faculty Relations, and the School of Medicine’s Faculty Work & Culture Optimization Collaborative for well-being.

The Communications, Services & Projects Facilitator has a unique cross-functional skill set and is exceptional across many areas of communications and is skilled at moving between cross-functional project management and providing operational support and services. The Communications, Services & Projects Facilitator supports, develops, manages, coordinates, and delivers a variety of projects, services, and initiatives, taking care of “every day” operational, business, and administrative needs, as well as more complex initiatives for OFE. The person hired into this new role is excited to contribute their unique combination of skills to a new unit in the SOM Dean’s Office. This new hire will enjoy fostering a welcoming, communicative, and service-focused environment and holding oneself accountable for delivering exceptional outcomes for the OFE team.

Key Responsibilities:

Cross-Functional Communications (~60% of time)

Manages, develops, coordinates, and delivers diverse communications across OFE and the SOM, including webpages, social media, e-newsletters, technical user guides and e-resources, campaigns, promotions, program marketing, stakeholder engagement initiatives, presentation materials, visual communications, data representations, videos, storytelling and narrative-building initiatives, fact summaries, annual and other reports – among others, depending on the communication needs of the OFE team.Coordinates with the team, and launches, manages, and aligns branding, webpages, and a variety of other communications across OFE.Listens, understands, and then develops narratives, engaging stories, faculty and program guides/directions/process communications, and other stakeholders, shares about the faculty experience, and distributes information about OFE to the SOM.

Project Management & Facilitation of Service Improvements (~30% of time)

Independently and collaboratively manages projects, programs, and other initiatives at various stages (such as during development, piloting, implementation, evaluation, quality and continuous improvement, and ongoing administration).Manages special operational improvement projects (may include projects in business services, faculty process administration, development and training, events, communication, and with databases and IT – among others).Takes direction, proactively seeks clarification, focuses on solution development, and with advanced diplomatic skill, communicates “up, across and downstream” to address challenges to deliver on assignments and meet OFE objectives.

Executive & Operational Services (~10% of time)

Supports administrative leaders/executives on special projects, business services, and various operational and administrative needs (including everyday administration areas and initiatives at higher levels of complexity).Moves effortlessly and with advanced ability and dexterity between diverse assignments that may cross-function and demand different skills, communications, and approaches to complete the assignment. Leans, follows, and accurately and appropriately applies CU/SOM policies and processes across all areas of work, and holds project teams to the same high standards.Completes other duties as assigned.

This description is a summary only and describes the general level of work to be performed. It is not intended to be all-inclusive, and percentages are estimates only. The duties of this position are evolving as OFE grows and develops and may change from time to time and/or based on needs. We reserve the right to add modify or delete duties and responsibilities at the discretion of the supervisor and/or hiring authority.

Work Location:

Hybrid – this role is eligible for a hybrid schedule of 3 days per week on campus and as needed for in-person meetings. Alternative work schedules and remote work, up to 2 days a week, can be approved, in accordance with campus policy (https://www.ucdenver.edu/offices/human-resources/remote-work-participation-agreement).

Why Join Us:

The Offices for the Faculty Experience (OFE) is a newly established unit within the Dean’s Office in the School of Medicine, residing on the University of Colorado Anschutz Medical Campus. This unit includes the Office for Faculty Relations (OFR), the Office for Faculty Development (OFD), the Office for Faculty Affairs (OFA), and the School of Medicine’s Faculty Work & Culture Optimization Collaborative for well-being.

OFE works with and collaborates across all SOM departments and the Office of the Dean, including the Office of Clinical Affairs, Office of Research, Office of Medical Education, and Office of Business Affairs. OFE serves as a central point of contact for faculty within the School of Medicine, through the school’s 6 basic science departments, 18 clinical science departments, and 12 centers and institutes. Nearly 5000 faculty, as well as part-time and volunteer clinical faculty, are represented and supported by the processes, services, and initiatives administered and led by the OFE team.

The University of Colorado Anschutz Medical Campus is a world-class medical destination at the forefront of transformative science, medicine, education, and patient care. The campus encompasses the University of Colorado health professional schools, more than 60 centers and institutes, and two nationally ranked independent hospitals, UCHealth University of Colorado Hospital and Children’s Hospital Colorado, that treat more than two million adult and pediatric patients each year.

Innovative, interconnected and highly collaborative, the University of Colorado Anschutz Medical Campus delivers life-changing treatments, patient care, and professional training, and conducts world-renowned research fueled by over $650 million in research grants. For more information, visit www.cuanschutz.edu.

The University of Colorado offers a comprehensive benefits package that includes health insurance, life insurance, retirement plans, tuition benefits, ECO pass, paid time off – vacation, sick, holidays, and more. To see what benefits are available, please visit: https://www.cu.edu/employee-services/benefits-wellness.

Diversity and Equity:

The University of Colorado Anschutz Medical Campus is committed to recruiting and supporting a diverse student body, faculty, and administrative staff. The university strives to promote a culture of inclusiveness, respect, communication and understanding. We encourage applications from women, ethnic minorities, persons with disabilities, persons within the LGBTQ+ community, and all veterans. The University of Colorado is committed to diversity and equality in education and employment.

Qualifications:

Minimum Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university. 4 or more years of experience in communications, marketing, branding, webpage management, e-communications, project management, team coordination, supporting administrative leaders, and/or other relevant areas.

Title:  Head of Foundational Hosting Infrastructure-Technology Executive

Wells Fargo Technology

Technology at Wells Fargo is at the heart of what enables us to satisfy our customers' financial needs and help them succeed financially. The Wells Fargo Technology (WFT) team leads technology for one of the highest market cap financial services institutions in the world, helping 76.6 million customers conduct an average of 95 million transactions each day, helping more end-customers every day - both in the United States and across the globe - than any other division in our company.

Wells Fargo Technology's goal is to exceed Wells Fargo customers' expectations and directly enable them to succeed financially. Through technology and operations services, Wells Fargo Technology interacts with customers more than 12 billion times a year through branch, mobile, online, ATM and telephone transactions. Wells Fargo Technology impacts customers directly through systems availability and security, as well as indirectly, through Wells Fargo business partners who offer and deliver a myriad of products and services that meet customers financial needs. Wells Fargo Technology strives to be a competitive advantage for the company and effective information management is one example of where we can take our capabilities to a new level of excellence.

The Wells Fargo Technology team helps customers directly every time they do business with the company, delivering a true One Wells Fargo experience and ensuring their security, regardless of channel. We also help customers by remaining trusted partners working with all lines of business (LOB) to develop and deliver value-added products and services. To do this, Wells Fargo Technology draws on the talents and motivation of thousands of technology team members across the enterprise.

Chief Technology Office

The Chief Technology Office (CTO) supports and delivers enterprise infrastructure and tech for tech services that enable Wells Fargo customers globally. The group is responsible for enterprise-wide services across the global footprint, including networking, production services, developer experience tools, centralized technology governance and controls, storage, data centers, mainframe, midrange and Cloud-based systems, distributed systems, and international infrastructure.

CTO is undergoing a major transformation in the way we deliver services, including new cloud modeled data centers, new and modern development tools, adoption of a product operating model based on agile principles, and a customer-center frictionless delivery approach. The transformation effort aligns resources to the standard total business management approach, combined with a simplified, product-oriented re-structuring requiring a shift from command and control to collaborate to automate, placing speedy standardized solutions in the hands of the consumer directly. This move supports the ten-year vision of Wells Fargo Technology to operate fully in the cloud.

Position Responsibilities And Expected Outcomes

Head of Foundational Hosting Infrastructure 

CTO is hiring an executive leader that possess broad-based experience transforming technology organizations within a regulated environment and complex architectural, financial and talent constraints. The new Chief Technology Office (CTO) - Foundational Hosting Platform (FHP) - Head of Foundational Hosting Infrastructure position will lead the consolidated organizational product transformation into a sustainable FHP-Risk and Resiliency (FHP-RR) governed function using a risk-based approach to achieve talent, tools, and techniques compliant with required industry rules, regulations, and laws. You will own the strategic roadmaps for Compute, Storage and Mainframe technologies.

This position is necessary to consolidate three products and/or organizational functions within the Foundational Hosting Platform (FHP) to build resiliency and risk efficiencies and align with regulatory rules, regulations, and laws to reach control sustainability continuous improvement, and governance across the Compute, Storage and Mainframe & Midrange Services along with Automation Services and Data Protection Services. The environment consists of 42,000 physical servers, ~130K Virtual Machine Servers, ~800 Petabytes of Block, File, Object, and backup storage. Mainframe, Midrange, and Unisys compute environments requiring high availability, local and geographic resilience, and data protection.

title: Assembly Technician/Quality Control Inspector
description:
Electromechanical Quality Assembly Technician

Temp-To-Hire Opportunity

Onsite in Chatsworth, CA 91311

M-F, 7am-3:30pm

Payrate: $21.63/hr

Weekly pay and Benefits!

Our leading software development client is hiring an Electromechanical Quality Assembly Technician to join their team in Chatsworth, CA! The electromechanical Quality Assembly Technician is a pivotal role responsible for the precision assembly of electromechanical components and systems, as well as conducting rigorous inspections and tests to guarantee the quality, functionality, and compliance of these products. This role demands a unique blend of mechanical aptitude, electrical knowledge, meticulous attention to detail, and a steadfast commitment to quality.

Job Duties

 Electromechanical Assembly: Interpret mechanical drawings and electrical schematics to accurately assemble electromechanical devices and systems.  Utilize a range of hand and power tools, as well as soldering equipment, to assemble, install, and secure components.  Quality Inspection and Testing: Perform detailed inspections of electromechanical assemblies for structural quality, electrical continuity, and functional performance.  Document inspection findings, including any deviations from specifications or defects, and initiate corrective actions or adjustments.  Troubleshooting and maintenance: Diagnose issues with electromechanical assemblies during and after the assembly process, identifying root causes and implementing effective solutions.  Conduct routine maintenance on assembly and testing equipment to ensure optimal performance.  Process Improvement and Compliance: Collaborate with engineering and production teams to refine assembly and inspection processes for enhanced quality and efficiency.  Ensure all activities comply with industry standards, regulatory requirements, and company quality policies.  Safety and Cleanliness: Adhere to strict safety guidelines and protocols, including the use of personal protective equipment (PPE) to prevent injuries and accidents.  All personnel are trained in ESD safety procedures, including proper handling of ESD-sensitive components, use of grounding devices, and personal conduct in the ESD environment.  Maintain a clean and orderly work environment, ensuring tools and equipment are stored properly. 

Requirements

 Educational Background: A technical diploma or associate degree in electromechanical technology, electronics, mechanical engineering, or a related field is preferred (not required).  Experience: Prior experience in electromechanical assembly and quality inspection, preferably in a ESD controlled manufacturing or production facility, involving work with electromechanical equipment and potentially hazardous materials.  Technical proficiency: Strong understanding of mechanical components and electrical systems, with the ability to use various testing and assembly tools.  Attention to Detail: Exceptional precision and focus when assembling intricate components and conducting quality inspections.  Problem-Solving Skills: Proficient in diagnosing and resolving electromechanical issues, with a proactive approach to troubleshooting.  Communication Abilities: Clear and effective communication skills for documenting processes, reporting inspection results, and collaborating with team members. 

Work Environment

 The role is primarily situated in an ESD controlled manufacturing or production facility, involving work with electromechanical equipment and potentially hazardous materials.  Requires the ability to stand or sit for extended periods, perform repetitive tasks, and occasionally lift heavy objects.  May involve exposure to minimal noise.

title: Manager Internal Communications
description:
ECU Health

About ECU Health

ECU Health is a mission-driven, 1,708-bed academic health care system serving more than 1.4 million people in 29 eastern North Carolina counties. The not-for-profit system is comprised of 13,000 team members, nine hospitals and a physician group that encompasses over 1,100 academic and community providers practicing in over 180 primary and specialty clinics located in more than 130 locations.

The flagship ECU Health Medical Center, a Level I Trauma Center, and ECU Health Maynard Children’s Hospital serve as the primary teaching hospitals for the Brody School of Medicine at East Carolina University. ECU Health and the Brody School of Medicine share a combined academic mission to improve the health and well-being of eastern North Carolina through patient care, education and research.

Position Summary

The Manager, Internal Communications is responsible for developing, driving and supporting internal communications strategies, processes, plans and content for ECU Health. The manager leads collaboration and partnerships with cross-functional leaders and teams to ensure the Internal Communications team is best supporting the organization's needs.

This position reports to the Director, Communication and partners with Internal Communications team and the External Communications team.

This individual interacts with senior leaders and their teams to provide strategic consultation, communications planning and ensures implementation of internal communications tactics. The primary focus for this position will be long-term, system-wide strategic initiatives.

Every team member at ECU Health is expected to exemplify our values in all behaviors and interactions: integrity, compassion, education, accountability, safety and teamwork.

Responsibilities

Consult and implement system-wide internal communications strategies, plans and tactics that support the overall System of Communications and align with the organization's Mission, Vision and Values.

Champions and articulates the organization's Mission and Vision in all verbal and written communications.

Maintain and enhance internal communications-owned channels and tools.

Exhibit sound judgment by effectively counseling leaders by listening, understanding and providing credible expertise, relevant insights and transparent feedback.

Collaborate with cross-functional leaders and teams on internal initiatives and programs, and provide the communications consultation, planning and implementation.

Partner with Communications Team to ensure alignment on strategies, messaging and communications timelines.

Write and edit messaging for senior-level leaders (emails, talking points, PowerPoints, etc.).

Partner with external agencies, as appropriate.

Support the organization's crisis communication planning and response, as needed.

Minimum Requirements

Five to seven years related experience.

Bachelor's Degree or higher.

Major in Communications, English, Journalism, Public Relations, or similar discipline.

Proven experience and ability in internal communications in a multi-faceted organization.

Strong interpersonal, verbal and writing skills.

Creative, collaborative, open-minded and flexible personality.

Strong professional copywriting and editing skills for a variety of audiences.

Solution-oriented and high level of attention to details.

Proficiency in Microsoft Office, specifically in Word and PowerPoint.

Proficiency in SharePoint intranet management.

Experience in providing strategic communications counsel to senior-level executives, and demonstrated ability to challenge decisions to influence better outcomes.

Ability to respond to rapidly changing conditions with agility and judgment.

$20.98 per hour

Full-time / Evening Shift

This is a seasonal (temporary) position. Full-Time hours are available May 1st - September 30th.

This labor-intensive position is responsible for hand building pallets of product for bulk, and route trucks. Each type of loading requires strict attention to order accuracy with respect to loading outgoing trucks and unloading incoming trucks. Works from Electronic order system or order sheets to build loads using a forklift and/or electronic pallet jack. Position is responsible for accuracy in loading and complying with shipper/receiver documentation. Follows warehouse instructions in building loads (). Employees must maintain a clean and safe work environment. Position may be required to work across a wide variety of weather conditions and hours, shift duration depends on work load and may vary daily.

Transport truck loading involves moving full pallets of products from the warehouse onto a trailer and removing any returned pallets/plastic flats. Responsible for unloading raw materials and placing them in designated warehouse space.

Bulk truck loading involves selecting designated packages and flavors of products from the warehouse and loading them onto a pallet. Position is responsible for maintaining the stability of the pallet through proper stacking and shrink-wrapping. In most cases, pallets are loaded onto a trailer for local delivery. Position is responsible for unloading returned products and pallets/plastic flats.

Route truck loading involves selecting designated packages and flavors or pallets of products from the warehouse and loading them into the truck. Product/packages for each truck are customized based on the salespersons order. Position is responsible for unloading returned products and pallets/plastic flats.

Position requires lifting a very high volume of cases of product per day from 20-45 pounds per case repeatedly during a long work period. Requires constant standing, walking, bending, twisting, squatting reaching and grasping as product is moved.

PRIMARY JOB ACCOUNTABILITIES: 

Drive power pallet jack or forklift to picking area and build pallet/load according to load sheet or voice pick audio equipment (if applicable)Mark load ticket for out of stock itemsWrap pallet when pallet/load is finishedTurn in paper work with order for check before loading and have truck checkedStage pallet and/or load into truck when readyComplete partial pallets and put away mixed palletsMaintain proper housekeeping standards in work areaRegular, reliable, predictable attendance

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:

18 years or older

HELPFUL EXPERIENCE:

Experience working in a warehouse environment (e.g., order selector/picking product storage, product staging, powered pallet jack/forklifts, etc.)Driving a forklift (e.g., performing basic operations such as driving forwards, driving backwards, lifting and lowering boom, maneuvering in tight areas without damaging product, etc.)Working with racking systems and loading/unloading pallets (e.g., pulling and placing pallets on/off vertical product racking systems and trucks, maximizing storage by stacking products vertically, etc.)Experience working in a team environment (e.g., cooperating with co-workers, joint problem solving, etc.)

description:
Description

Gibbs & Cox, a wholly owned subsidiary of Leidos, is the largest independent naval architecture and marine engineering firm in the United States. Since our founding in 1929, 24 classes of combatants and nearly 7,000 vessels have been built to Gibbs & Cox designs. We proudly support military and commercial clients in the U.S. and internationally with all phases of marine design, construction, and lifecycle management. In this role, you will be responsible for technical and program management for two G&C Teams providing Engineering Services in support of LPD 17 Flight II DD&C and the LAW Program’s LSM Ship design from requirements development through award and DD&C.

Location : This is a hybrid remote job. Candidate must be local to our Washington DC office in order to attend meetings on average 1-2 days per week.

Managing program(s) profit and loss (P&L), costs, scheduling, quality and timely delivery of engineering services.Supporting PMS 317 and PMS 377 and NAVSEA 05 in support of ship design, engineering and construction of LPD and LSM class ships.Staffing, mentoring and leading multidisciplinary teams to support your portfolio.Supporting our ISO-9001 engineering process and development methodology.Interacting with customers regarding programmatic and technical issues.

Candidate Requirements

U.S. Citizenship and an Active Security Clearance.BS or Advanced Degree in Naval Architecture or Marine Engineering or other relevant Engineering degree balanced with professional experience in NAVY ship design15(+) Years of proven experience providing relevant program management services.20(+) Years of proven experience in NAVY ship design, engineering and construction.Strong network with NAVSEA 05, PEO Ships, PEO IWS and their NAVY Support Labs in Philadelphia, Dahlgren and Carderock.Prefer someone with experience with NAVWARCOM, NAVAIR and MARCORP for ship integration of their systems on NAVY Ships.Strong background in NAVY ship design, engineering, and production.Experience with Amphibious ships, specifically with LPD 17 Class ships is desired.Experience leading diverse multidisciplinary technical teams.Familiarity with the DOD/DON acquisitions process and experience in supporting large programs and/or experience with US Navy, DOD, and commercial maritime surface ships.Must have a deep understanding of technical, financial, budgeting, programmatic, business development and personnel management for government services contracts.Strong oral and written communication and presentation skills.Proficiency in standard MS Office suite.

description:

This position pays a $2500 sign-on bonus (non-Jabil external candidates only) 

Job Summary

Provide lead equipment and process support (including machine maintenance) to printed circuit assembly lines.

Must have manufacturing knowledge or experience with SMT processes for PCBA box builds, wave soldering, selective soldering and experience with PMs and troubleshooting of soldering equipment.

Job Qualifications

KNOWLEDGE REQUIREMENTS

 Demonstrated Hands-on experience in the required process.  Advanced Knowledge in the area that is being assigned.  Relentless in exploring new and latest methods in improving assembly techniques.  Lead Process and Equipment Evaluation aligned to the needs of Site as assigned by the ME Manager.  Knowledge in Basic Statistics and knowledge of carrying a DOE is a plus.  Understanding of DFM/A, FMEA and IPC requirements.  Able to write technical reports for the Site. 

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include the following. Other duties may be assigned.

 Maintain and develop machine programs, part definition (PD) files and machine set-ups.  Optimize machine programs and set-ups to meet or exceed theoretical product run-rate.  Observe machine and line performance and determine the necessary steps needed to achieve optimum line efficiency and product quality.  Monitor CIQ, TARS, ICT Diagnostic defect analysis sheet, feeder data (and other available sources of information) continuously for tracking and gauging machine and process performance.  Maintain and repair all SMT equipment on assigned line(s).  Determine when necessary machine repairs are needed and perform out-of-cycle maintenance.  Perform ‘as-required’ preventative maintenance of SMT equipment on assigned line(s).  Perform initial diagnosis of non-SMT equipment on assigned line(s), and execute repairs within skill level. Escalate more complex issues to Industrial Techs, and provide assistance as needed to accomplish repairs.  Assist Machine Operators on assigned line(s) by providing ongoing training and direction.  Assist with machine operation in order to expedite changeover, cover breaks, or otherwise improve line efficiency.  Interface with Line Supervisors, Manufacturing Engineers and Machine Support Manager to determine corrective actions needed, and be the front line person in ensuring that assigned line(s) performs with the maximum efficiency and product quality.  Provide training to Manufacturing Engineering Tech I employees.  Assist Manufacturing Engineers in achieving optimum process performance by measuring and / or optimizing of reflow profiles, wave solder profiles, and screen printing of solder paste.  Provide recommendations for designing, fabricating and / or modifying necessary tooling, and product design for manufacturability (DFM) improvements.  Provide daily ‘pass-down’ reports to Project Engineer, Manufacturing Engineer and the Manufacturing Engineering Technician on the following shift.  Adhere to all safety and health rules and regulations associated with this position and as directed by supervisor.  Comply with all procedures within the company security policy. 

Education And Minimum Requirements

Associate’s degree highly preferred

Minimum of three to five years related knowledge or experience with SMT process, wave soldering, selective soldering and/or training

Minimum three years of experience with PMs and troubleshooting of SMT and soldering manufacturing equipment on circuit assembly lines

Or equivalent combination of education and experience.

title: Infrastructure Operations
description:
Forward is on a bold mission to make high-quality healthcare available to a billion people across the globe. We’re building the world’s most advanced healthcare platform from the ground up, combining hardware, software, and doctors under one roof.

Forward was founded in January 2016 by former executives and engineering leaders from Google and Uber. We are funded by some of the world's best investors and entrepreneurs, including Founder's Fund, Khosla Ventures, First Round Capital, Eric Schmidt (Google/Alphabet Chairman), Marc Benioff (Salesforce Founder), Joe Lonsdale (Palantir Founder), and Garrett Camp (Uber co-Founder).

Press And Videos

Health Moves Forward [CEO Blog Post]

Forward Health Launched CarePods [Tech Crunch]

An AI Doctor In A Box Coming To A Mall [Forbes]

Former Googler Adrian Aoun raises $100 million for walk-in AI healthcare pods [Fortune]

In pursuit of massively increasing access to healthcare across the globe, we are building a new healthcare system from the ground up. There are thousands of hard problems to solve, and the potential to make world-changing impact.

In this role you’ll be responsible for defining the operational infrastructure that eventually delivers healthcare to billions and operating that infrastructure to deliver care to our current members. You’ll have to balance an ability to execute with an ability to build processes and tools to scale that execution.

You WIll

Execute to keep the business working like a well oiled machine - build, maintain, supply, and measure the infrastructure (environment, equipment, inventory, compliance, etc.) that supports the delivery of care. Own performance metrics for the sub-system you own.Identify and implement scalable processes and tools to automate yourself out of the execution work. (Bonus points if you build/iterate simple software tools in JavaScript, Python, and/or SQL.)Solve really hard problems with clear framing, a deep understanding of the data, creative options, a clear recommendation, and prioritization conversations with cross-functional stakeholders and senior leaders.Collaborate with cross functional teams to implement recommendations..

You Are

Impact-Driven - You want to leave the world better than you found it, so you believe there’s more to life than software that enables puppy ears to be superimposed in photos. (Although we concede those are cute.)An Owner - You act like an owner, not an employee. You take initiative. Nothing is too big or too small for you to lend a hand.A Problem Solver - You love breaking down highly complex problems into their component parts, communicating insights, and implementing high ROI (return on investment) solutions.Detail-Oriented - You are exceptionally well organized and thorough.Scrappy - You hustle and you roll up your sleeves to get stuff done.A Trusted Partner - Teammates want to be in the trenches with you.

Minimum Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree3+ years of experience solving problems, implementing recommendations, and executing business processesExcellent communication skillsProficient in GSheets or Excel

Startup experience where you had to work in a fast-paced, ambiguous environment with constantly changing prioritiesProven ability to understand complex systemsManagement consulting experienceConstruction or manufacturing experienceSupply chain or logistics experience

We don’t want to just move dollars around the healthcare industry - we want to rebuild it and fix it. All of it. You’d be a major part of the story behind one of the most ambitious startup attempts of the past decade and you’d work with a team of people who want to use their talents for good.

ECI is seeking a Sales Engineering Professional to provide ERP software solutions to manufacturing businesses.

Responsible for demonstrating the Manufacturing division’s ERP software and solutions to fit customer needs. Presenting in a board room setting and frequent travel are key expectations of this role.

Responsibilities

 Explain and demonstrate the features and benefits of ECI’s Manufacturing ERP software to prospects, specifically the Deacom ERP solution.  Ability to clearly articulate and describe batch-and-process manufacturing operations to include formulation, inventory management, MRP, quality management, and other related processes.  Actively participate in scoping, discovery, and proposal review sessions with prospects and customers.  Assist sales teams in identifying and presenting solutions for complex business management processes. Ability to articulate solution options, associated risk-benefit analysis, solution pros and cons, and suggest process change recommendations.  Conduct customized and focused product demonstrations in-person or virtually to small and large audiences.  Communicate effectively and work with cross-functional teams.  Ability to bring new ideas regarding industry best practices and process improvements using ECI solutions.  Familiarity with ERP solutions and implementations.  Meet assigned sales targets, contribute to overall sales growth.  Serve as a technical liaison between prospects and ECI.  Interface with product management and development teams regarding feature requests and solution enhancements.  Coordinate RFx responses to meet required timelines and expectations.  Support marketing, attend trade shows, support solutions webinars, and create product-focused and informative videos for general consumption.  Articulate technical requirements and complex business processes in a manner that is easy to understand.  Maintain technical knowledge, attend certification training, and conduct product training.

 Minimum of 10 years relevant experience selling and/or supporting software and SaaS solutions.  Minimum of 7 years of experience navigating and working with ERP software.  Minimum of 5 years of experience presenting in-person or virtually to large audiences.  Self-motivated with a proven track record in software systems and professional services sales.  Knowledge of cloud solutions, public (AWS, Azure, Google) including private multi-tenant and single-tenant environments.  Strong interpersonal skills, ability to interface with both technical and nontechnical team members.  Ability to multitask in a fast-paced presales environment, supporting multiple projects at any given time.  In-depth knowledge of batch and process manufacturing or requisite experience working for a manufacturer in this environment.  Understand how a manufacturer operates from “quote to cash”.  Highly dependable, possess good organization and time management skills.  Excellent written, verbal, and presentation skills.  BS in an engineering discipline (CS, EE, IE, etc.) or a related field required.  Must possess strong presentation and communication skills including web-based video-driven sessions.  Able to communicate professionally, both written and verbal.  Well organized with the ability to eliminate sales obstacles through creative and adaptive approaches.  Proficient with Microsoft Office software suite and MS Teams  Working knowledge with APIs, SQL, and other relational databases.  Experience with Salesforce.com a plus.  Ability to travel up to 40%.

title: Director Estimating, Global Engineering Solutions
description:
Job Description

The Global Engineering Solutions (GES) Director of Estimating is a key position in the Project Business & Solutions (PBS) team whose function is to provide effective and innovative cost solutions to our business partners to maximize their value and for our teams to ensure successful project execution. The Director of Estimating will lead a Global team and be an active member of the PBS Leadership Team.

The successful candidate will provide technical support for planning and estimating capital projects, from feasibility studies and FEL, through execution and start-up. The candidate must have strong skills in the areas of people management, estimating, planning, and benchmarking. The position supports multiple projects, that range small to large capital programs.

Responsibilities Include

Leads diverse team to serve a portfolio of strategic and standard segmented projects by developing capital estimates from long range capital planning, scope development, execution to completion and financial closeout within time, budget, EHS, and quality constraints. Assembles, develops, and motivates cross-functional teams, internal and external resources to develop scope and execute projects. Collaborate across multiple GES functions, internal partners, and geographies to develop estimating requirements and strategies.Ensures team: adheres to standard work; identifies least cost scope and ensures competitive scope options are visible, properly quantified and in line with critical to success factors for the project; ensures Target Value Design process is implemented on projects and facilitator is trained; and escalates emerging issues/challenges in a timely fashion to enable proactive vs reactive mitigations.Effective utilization of the change management and control processes and the ability to clearly articulate change requirements to deliver successful project objectives.Utilize and continuously improve/develop quantitative data and benchmarks to validate estimates and inform team and management decision making, in collaboration with internal and external relationshipsLead and resource estimate risk analysis sessionsIn collaboration with the GES Project Controls group, set up project budgets per standard work breakdown structure and support preparation of project return cost data and close-out reports.Monitor and report on estimating metrics, trends, cost variances, and performance indicators to identify areas for improvement and inform management decisions.Lead development of comprehensive annual Market Intelligence and Market Conditions ReportSupport Estimating Steward and team with business data requests and market intelligence. Provide input on design and execution approaches inclusive of risk management.Stay updated with industry development, emerging technologies, and advancements in cost estimating methodologies, and incorporate relevant tools and techniques into the estimating process.Champion and deliver Estimating EducationChampion Integrated Project Delivery fostering key partnershipsSteward of the GES Governance Process

Role

As a global role and given the need to improve and establish standard work around conceptual estimating, benchmarking, and governance, it is critical for the Director to have a strong track record in the following:

Proven effective managerial experience in leading groups of diverse technical teams (external and internal), in multiple locations, by setting clear intent and expectations; focusing on professional development, succession planning, and coaching, as needed.Effective communication and interpersonal skills to interface effectively with all levels of colleagues in a team environment, and with external customersGlobal perspective and prior international experience preferred.Broad knowledge of the biopharmaceutical industry across multiple project types (drug substance, drug product, lab, large and small molecule, etc.) and all lines of business (Research and Development, Human Health, Animal Health)Strong thought and opinion leader and experience establishing solutions through collaboration and strong leadership.Ability to think strategically for a long-term vision in terms of culture, behavior, business processes and tools, yet meet tactical needs and tailor solutions.

Qualifications

Education:

Bachelor’s degree (Engineering discipline and advanced education preferred)

Required

10 + years of Estimating, Project Control, Design, Capital Management, and/or Project Management experienceAbility to travel across our Company sites up to 25% of their time.

Preferred

Strong knowledge of estimating, capital management, and financial processesExperience in Lean Project Delivery Methodologies (e.g., Target Value Delivery and Last Planner®, Takt planning)Knowledge of our Company’s Capital Management processesStrategic planning or portfolio management experienceLean/Six Sigma experience, change management expertise.Knowledge of AE, CM and Professional Service providers estimating means and methods

title: CDL Truck Driver
description:
Job Description

As an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, or veteran status.

I. Job Summary

Safely operates a heavy-duty truck to perform assigned duties on transfer routes.

II. Essential Duties And Responsibilities

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Other minor duties may be assigned.

Operates vehicle in accordance with Occupational and Safety Health Act (OSHA) and Department of Transportation (DOT) requirements as well as all local, state and federal requirements and Company expectations for the Fleet; maintains a clean and safe vehicle. Performs pre- and post-trip inspections of assigned vehicle using utilizing standard DVIR (Driver Vehicle Inspection Report); notes all issues on DVIR form for corrective review/repair. Immediately reports any unsafe situations or service calls to Route Manager or Dispatch before attempting service. Participates and cooperates in all scheduled training, briefings, and meetings as required by Route Manager. Works closely with Route Managers to improve route efficiencies and identify problem or unsafe accounts. Performs all duties as scheduled by Route Manager or Dispatch, assisting other company drivers as directed. Notifies Route Manager of any incidents, accidents, injures, or property damage. Notifies Dispatch or Route Manager of issues as prescribed by Service Machine protocol, including blocked containers, potential missed pick-ups or problems that arise on the route. Communicates customer requests or issues to Dispatch or Route Manager. Completely dumps all containers and leaves the customer’s location clean and free of debris. Completes and submits customer tickets when excess yardage must be removed. Positions containers on the customer’s property in a manner that ensures lids are properly replaced, containers are set in an upright position, and containers do not block driveway entrances or traffic. Follows route assignments throughout the day and completes all documentation when checking-in at the end of the route. 



III. Supervisory Responsibilities

This job has no supervisory duties.

IV. Qualifications

The requirements listed below are representative of the qualifications necessary to perform the job.

 Education and ExperienceEducation: None required. Experience: No prior work experience required.  Certificates, Licenses, Registrations or Other RequirementsCommercial Drivers License B (CDL). The CDL is a requirement, therefore, an applicant must be 18 years of age. Successfully complete pre-employment DOT drug screen, physical, and background check, which will include previous employment check, and motor vehicle record review. Acceptable driving record required. 



Benefits

At Waste Management, each eligible employee receives a competitive total compensation package including Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance and Short Term Disability. As well as a Stock Purchase Plan, Company match on 401K, and more! Our employees also receive Paid Vacation, Holidays, and Personal Days. Please note that benefits may vary by site.

About Us

 ABOUT WM

WM ( WM.com ) is North America’s largest comprehensive waste management environmental solutions provider. Previously known as Waste Management and based in Houston, Texas, WM is driven by commitments to put people first and achieve success with integrity. The company, through its subsidiaries, provides collection, recycling and disposal services to millions of residential, commercial, industrial and municipal customers throughout the U.S. and Canada. With innovative infrastructure and capabilities in recycling, organics and renewable energy, WM provides environmental solutions to and collaborates with its customers in helping them achieve their sustainability goals. WM has the largest disposal network and collection fleet in North America, is the largest recycler of post-consumer materials and is the leader in beneficial reuse of landfill gas, with a growing network of renewable natural gas plants and the most gas-to-electricity plants in North America. WM’s fleet includes nearly 11,000 natural gas trucks – the largest heavy-duty natural gas truck fleet of its kind in North America – where more than half are fueled by renewable natural gas. To learn more about WM and the company’s sustainability progress and solutions, visit Sustainability.WM.com .
